intro: Greenea commersonii, commonly known as the Commerson's greenea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
